summary: WE HAD THREE BLOW OUTS ON OUR TRAILER TIRES DURING A TRIP THIS FALL.  THE THREE BLOW OUTS OCCURRED ON THREE DIFFERENT DATES.  THE TIRES ARE COOPER OMNI ST 235/80R16.      THE FIRST BLOW OUT OCCURRED 8/21/2015 ON I-470 JUST PAST THE DENVER AIRPORT.  THIS BLOW OUT CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER ON THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE.      THE SECOND BLOW OUT OCCURRED SOMEWHERE NORTHEAST OF SANTA FE, NM ON I-25.  THIS BLOW OUT WAS ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE VEHICLE.  THIS BLOW OUT ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER.     THE THIRD BLOW OUT OCCURRED APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE WEST OF THE ARKANSAS BORDER ON HIGHWAY 412.  AGAIN, THIS CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE TRAILER.      THESE TIRES HAD LESS THAN 7,000 MILES ON THEM.  THE TIRES WERE PURCHASED IN LATE DECEMBER 2012.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR WITH TOWMASTER TIRES, SIZE: 235/80R/16E. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH, THE REAR DRIVER, PASSENGER AND FRONT PASSENGER TIRE BLEW WITHOUT WARNING. THE FAILURE OCCURRED ON THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS WITHIN A ONE MONTH PERIOD. THE TIRES WERE REPLACED AND THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 2,500. THE DOT NUMBER WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR RV. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE REAR BUMPER SEPARATED FROM THE FRAME OF THE VEHICLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 12V355000 (STRUCTURE:BODY:BUMPERS). THE RV WAS NOT REPAIRED.  THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 3,000.  UPDATED 01/30/13*LJ  PICTURES RECEIVED. 01/31/13

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2002 GMC SIERRA. THE VEHICLE WAS HITCHED TO A 2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR FIFTH WHEEL TRAILER. THE CONTACT INSPECTED THE VEHICLE AND NOTICED THAT THE FRONT END OF THE FRAME WAS FRACTURED IN TWO PLACES NEAR THE MAIN HITCH AREA. THE VEHICLE HAD NOT BEEN REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE PROBLEM. THE VEHICLE DID NOT CALCULATE MILEAGE.

CONSUMER STATES ONE YEAR AGO THEY PURCHASED A  2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR XLITE 26SAB FIFTH WHEEL. CONSUMER STATES PROBLEMS WITH CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR *TGW  THE CONSUMER STATED THE CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR WAS NOT DISPLAYING A GREEN LIGHT. AFTER REMOVING IT, THE CONSUMER DISCOVERED IT WAS NOT BATTERY OPERATED, BUT RATHER HARD WIRED. THE WIRES WERE NOT CONNECTED TO ANYTHING.  THE SCREWS TO THE DRAWERS WERE NOT LONG ENOUGH AND THE SLIDES HAD NO SUPPORT.  THE CABINET DOORS UNDER THE SINK CAME COMPLETELY OFF, DUE TO THE SCREWS NOT BEING PROPERLY SECURED.  THE DOOR AND SURROUNDING FRAME CAME OFF AND IT WAS DISCOVERED IT WAS KEPT IN PLACE WITH STAPLES AND NOT SCREWS.  ANOTHER MOTORIST ALERTED THE CONSUMER THAT THE BUMPER HAD COME LOOSE FROM THE BACK OF THE TRAILER AND THE SPARE TIRE WAS DRAGGING ON THE ROAD. A REPAIR SHOP RE-WELDED THE BUMPER USING METAL L'S TO HOLD IT IN PLACE. *JB

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR TRAILER322QBS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE WELDING IN THE FIFTH WHEEL AREA FAILED, CAUSING THE FIFTH WHEEL PIN TO FRACTURE. THE FIFTH WHEEL THEN SEPARATE FROM THE FRAME AS WELL AS THE BOLTS IN THE BED AND KITCHEN AREA.  THE TRAILER WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHO INSPECTED AND FOUND A DEFECTED WELDING THAT CAUSED THE FIFTH WHEEL PIN AND BOLTS TO FAIL. THE TRAILER WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE TRAILER DID NOT HAVE A MILEAGE TO BE REPORT.

DRIVING DOWN I-5 THE WELD BETWEEN THE INTERIOR PART OF THE WHEEL RIM AND THE EXTERIOR PART OF THE RIM BROKE.  OUR 5TH WHEEL TRAILER IS A 2010, BUT NOTICE THAT A RECALL HAS BEEN MADE ON SOME OF THE 2011 KEYSTONE TRAILERS.      [BOWMAN FIXED CONSUMER COMMENT:" THIS IS A KEYSTONE COUGAR, NOT WHAT IS SHOWN UNDER THE DESCRIPTION ON PAGE 3"]. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR LIGHT WEIGHT FIFTH WHEEL TRAVEL TRAILER. WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH THE TRAILER HITCH CAUSED THE SPARE TIRE TO FALL OFF DUE TO THE ITS WEIGHT AND THE WAY IT WAS WELDED ONTO THE RV. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND INFORMED HIM TO TAKE IT TO A REPAIR SHOP AND HAVE IT INSPECTED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 2,000.    UPDATED 02/10/11  *BF  THE REAR BUMPER CRACKED AT THE WELDS CAUSING REAR BUMPER WITH THE SPARE TIRE MOUNT TO FOLD DOWN AND DRAG ON THE HIGHWAY.   UPDATED 05/06/11

2010 KEYSTONE COUGAR FIFTH WHEEL CAMPER HAD A BLOWOUT ON THE LEFT REAR TIRE.  DRIVER LOST CONTROL AND THE VEHICLE AND TRAILER OVERTURNED ONTO THE ROADWAY.    *BF  (OHIO TRAFFIC CRASH REPORT #10-0364-89)*JB
